active_learning.discussion_prompt: Analyze the Sony Pictures hack of 2011, a real-world SQL injection attack. In groups, debate whether prepared statements alone would have prevented it, or if additional measures like input validation, least privilege database accounts, and Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) were necessary. Discuss trade-offs between security and performance in SaaS environments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in SQL Injection Prevention within SaaS Application Security (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cloud Service Models > SaaS > SaaS Application Security > SQL Injection Prevention). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards using the provided schema. Base content on OWASP Top 10 (A03:2021 Injection), SQL Injection Prevention Cheat Sheet, and Web Security Testing Guide. Ensure completeness: Fully explain prepared/parameterized statements (separate code/data), stored procedures, input validation/escaping (not standalone), ORM frameworks, least privilege DB accounts, WAFs. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding Layers: Distribute flashcards across 4 layers [INSERT FULL LAYER DESCRIPTIONS]. - Active Learning Context: Draw from discussion (Sony hack), peer teaching (code diffs), problem-solving (PHP refactor) for scenario-based cards. - Prior Knowledge: Link to basic SQL/user input. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: - Front: Question/MCQ/Cloze. - Back: Answer + Explanation (OWASP ref, Bloom's tag, misconception debunk) + References + Layer/Objective Tag. - Distractors: 3-4 plausible misconceptions per MCQ. Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'references': [...], 'tags': ['Layer 1', 'REMEMBER']}}, ...]. Ensure university pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active recall, no passive reading.
